job_title: Environmental Services in Green Bay, WI
pros: Flexible, paid pto , can take off if needed for appointments or family reasons, decent pay with extra training to get more pay. Good benefits but expensive
cons: Training was ok takes a good few months to learn each area especially if you’re put in the same area for a few weeks before moving on to another area. Few employees hid in closets, drew artwork on notepads, fiddled with papers , gossiped for over an hour at a time inside of working. I sometimes spent 4 hours cleaning glass doors in unused rooms

Culture is very good
Remote option in my position

job_title: Information Technology in Green Bay, WI
pros: Good work/life balance, great direct teammates. Stable working environment; good job security.
cons: Pay is below market rate, and several positions in IT are hourly instead of salaried, yet management has no problems calling you at all hours of the night if something goes awry. Project management is still new and lacking, change control doesn't exist outside of whatever norms you set for your own team. Projects are always done last minute with inadequate planning and resources. Technical teams are understaffed for the size of the organization. IT management is indecisive, decisions are always last minute or non-existent.

job_title: Referral Specialist in Green Bay, WI
pros:
-Holiday pay
-shift differential
-education benefits
-insurance for employees who work 20+ hrs a week.
cons:
The overall communication of the Bellin Health is sort of poor. The area where i work we are last to know about a change even though it is vital as we are the call center for all of Bellin. It is embarrassing when patients call asking about our programs anc we know nothing of it because a department or clinic does not notify us. Looks poor professionally.
Also, you have to agree to work at least two different shift types. So days/evenings or nights. Upper management does not listen well to the end user when changes are made.

review_title: Proud sponsor of Packers but not their employees

pros: Nothing really. I enjoyed my co-workers but that was about it.

review_title: Good atmosphere to work in and very community oriented

job_title: Patient Admissions Representative in Green Bay, WI
pros: Bellin has some great benefits, friendly co-workers, they gave us awesome Health Week gifts and Christmas gifts, and were very involved in the community (which I loved!).
cons: Being a big corporation, there is often a hierarchy that sometimes does not consider the ideas of lower-level workers. I think they were working on this but I often felt my ideas and my feelings were undervalued. This hierarchy also made it hard to enact change, as it had to go up the ladder to be approved and go to committees, etc etc.

review_title: Very dissatisfied with management and level of respect..
job_title: Medical Records in Green Bay, WI
pros: The hospital overall is a well-respected hospital, and I'm sure other departments have a positive vibe to them.
cons: The management is very disrespectful towards employees.  The level of communication is awful.  There is favoritism galore and lots of frustration due to this.   There is no opportunity for growth in this department at all.

review_title: Bellin sucks do not work here
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Green Bay, WI
pros: None, everyone snitches on each other and gets everyone fired.
cons: I was fired because someone told my educator on the floor that I did something that I never did.  Do not work here!!  Everyone treats you like you don’t belong to work here!  What I don't understand is how a nurse can have sex with a doctor and  not get fired, however I can get blamed for something that I didn't even do and get fired.  Everyone is also very clicky.

job_title: Medical Coder in Green Bay, WI
pros: Friendly coworkers, flexibility with work schedule.
cons: The quality of training for the coding staff is limited to none. Job opportunities are awarded by favoritism and who leadership likes the most rather then skill and ability to actually do the job. The coding department leadership team has done more damage then good. They are a big part of why Bellin has lost so many good coders to other employers and until some serious changes are made, they’ll continue to loose more. If you are a coder with any amount of skill and experience, don’t waste your time applying to work here as you will not be valued at all.  Look elsewhere and do yourself a favor.
